channel.title: Published Works on Alex Curley
channel.description: Recent content in Published Works on Alex Curley

item.title: NPR’s 24 most anticipated video games of 2024 | NPR.org
item.description: I previewed five big upcoming games - Life by You, Homeworld 3, Manor Lords, Frostpunk 2, and Stormgate - in this annual round-up.

item.title: The best games of 2023, picked by the NPR staff | NPR.org
item.description: My thoughts on Age of Wonders 4, Terra Nil, Diablo 4, and Company of Heroes 3, made our round-up of the top video games of 2023.

item.title: ‘Total War: Pharaoh’ and ‘Star Trek: Infinite’: boldly going where we’ve been before | NPR.org
item.description: Two big strategy games debuted in the same week: Total War: Pharaoh, and Star Trek: Infinite. I took a deep dive into both in this standalone article.

item.title: Detective Pikachu Returns, Assassin’s Creed Mirage and more Fall games reviewed | NPR.org
item.description: I reviewed Homeseek, the Frostpunk-esque city-builder, in NPR’s Fall 2023 round-up.

item.title: 'Diablo IV' Review: Activision Blizzard deals old-school devilish delights | NPR.org
item.description: Activision Blizzard’s blockbuster Diablo IV landed in May 2023 after much anticipation (and an impressive marketing blitz). I got to give the game a full treatment, including some custom gameplay GIFs.

item.title: What doesn't kill you makes you a strong Black woman: Rico Nasty | Louder Than A Riot
item.description: I contributed some voice work for this episode on NPR’s (now former) hip-hop podcast Louder Than A Riot.

item.title: 'Age of Wonders 4' Review: This Magical Mystery Game is Hoping to Take You Away | NPR.org
item.description: Triumph’s Age of Wonders 4 topped my list of top strategy games in an otherwise disappointing year for the genre. I recounted my triumphs and tribulations in this full review on NPR.org.

item.title: NPR staff review the biggest games of March, and more | NPR.org
item.description: In March of 2023, I gave glowing reviews to Terra Nil, the post-apocalyptic city-builder, and the Diablo IV beta.

item.title: Everyone Everywhere All At Once | Throughline
item.description: Ocassionally I will don an old-timey newscaster voice for Throughline, NPR’s excellent history podcast. I’ve made at least 8 appearances since the podcast began.

item.title: NPR staff review the best new games and some you may have missed | NPR.org
item.description: Pharoah, the 1999 city-building classing, was resurrected in February of 2023. I wrote a short review for that Spring’s gaming round-up.

item.title: 'Company of Heroes 3' deserves a spot in any war game fan's library | NPR.org
item.description: I was complimentary of, but not blown away by, Company of Heroes 3 in my first standalone gaming review for NPR. Also my first official by-line on the website.

item.title: The latest on the attacks in Ukraine | State of Ukraine
item.description: I produced and launched this news-responsive podcast, State of Ukraine, shortly after Russia began its invasion. This is the inaugural episode.

item.title: Chugga Chugga CHEW CHEW! The Science of Misophonia | Wow in the World
item.description: I provided technical and production support for children’s podcast Wow in the World from their inception in 2017 until they left the NPR network in 2020. This is my last credited appearance.

item.title: Crickets And Cannibals: Unpacking The Complicated Emotion Of Disgust | Hidden Brain
item.description: I tried baked cricket snacks in front of a microphone for Hidden Brain in 2018. They weren’t bad! I also provided the show with some voicework in 2019.
